Specific Details: General Election 2016
DPOs Lobbied: Richard Boyd Barrett|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: General Election 2016
Intended Results: Explain the content of Inclusion Ireland's General Election Manifesto 'A Disability Manifesto for Equality and Human Rights' which covers Inclusion Ireland's position on Advocacy Supports, Therapy Services, Access to Early Education, Inclusive Education Supports, Life-Long Education and Training, Direct Payments, Recognising the Cost of Disability, Assisted-Decision-Making Supports, Disability Hate Crime and Respite Care.
Lobbying Activities: People Before Profit Disability Forum discussion at the Buswells Hotel on Tuesday, 12th January on health services, cost of disability, direct payments, the ratification of the UNCRPD and equality for persons with disabilities.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Communications & Information Officer Cormac Cahill and Training & Development Officer Sarah Lennon.

Specific Details: Public Meeting about the crisis facing staffing levels in St. Michael's hospital. Under the 'Pay and Numbers Strategy' no new staff are being appointed, no cover for maternity leave, no replacements when someone retires. This poses significant dangers to our public health services.
DPOs Lobbied: Richard Boyd Barrett|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Public Meeting about the crisis facing staffing levels in St. Michael's hospital. Under the 'Pay and Numbers Strategy' no new staff are being appointed, no cover for maternity leave, no replacements when someone retires. This poses significant dangers to our public health services.
Intended Results: The intended result was to aid in advancing issues facing nurses in St. Michael's hospital
Lobbying Activities: Deputy Richard Boyd Barrett TD organised a public meeting on the 2nd of October which Ms Phil Ni Sheaghdha attended. |Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Ms Phil Ní Sheaghdha, General Secretary INMO
